page.title: 02Farming in the locality.
page.content:
Farming in the Burnhervie area.
Agriculture in this area is mostly arable. Approximately thirty per cent of the land is used for this purpose. The best arable land is that nearest to the River Don to the south of the block. A number of farms are situated along the Blackhall road which runs from Inverurie to Aquhorthies. The principal summer crop is barley which is grown by almost all farmers in the block. The main winter crip is turnip. There is some dairy farming at Blackhall Dubston and Alton farms. Blackhall farm is an important poultry producer particularly larger fowl such as geese and turkey. Farming is a major source of work, as it is throughout the wider area.
